definitions: Past tense of 'stroke': moved one's hand or an object gently over a surface, typically repeatedly.
Past tense of 'stroke': hit (a ball) smoothly and with control.
Past tense of 'stroke': rowed (a boat) from the stroke position.
examples: She stroked the cat's soft fur.
He stroked the golf ball perfectly.
The crew stroked the boat in unison.
